intro: Moquilea chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Moquilea chiriquiensis is often found in shaded, moist environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
